intro.label: Config file info
intro.body:
Config can also be changed by manually altering config file.
For changes to take effect, reload it in game using hotkeys:
- CTRL + P

Config file location:
- [WoT game directory]/mods/configs/DispersionReticle/config.json
intro.note:
If you want to generate default config file, delete its file and:
- either reload it with above hotkey
- or launch a game again
intro.attention: Don't use CTRL + P hotkey with open mod configurator.
This gui won't notice it unless reopened.
standardFocusedReticle.label: Dispersion reticle
standardFocusedReticle.body: Adds reticle displaying fully-focused dispersion to standard reticle.
standardFocusedReticle.note: When both client-side and server-side reticle are on, it attaches to client-side reticle.
standardHybridReticle.label: Latency reticle
standardHybridReticle.body: Adds reticle displaying current server-side dispersion to client-side reticle.
standardHybridReticle.note:
Basically, client-side position, but server-side dispersion.
By this, client-side and server-side dispersion desynchronization is clearly visible.

Useful if you want to know server-side dispersion, but still want client-side responsiveness.
standardHybridReticle.hideStandardReticl: If checked, standard client reticle is hidden while latency reticle is enabled.
Useful if you want to only use latency reticle instead of standard reticle.
standardServerReticle.label: Server reticle
standardServerReticle.body: Adds server-side reticle alongside with client-side reticle.
customServerReticle.label: Simple server reticle
customServerReticle.body: Adds server-side reticle with customizable shape alongside with client-side reticle.
customServerReticle.attention: For SPG artillery view, it will implicitly enable Server reticle on the left
customServerReticle.shape.body: Shape which this reticle should have.
customServerReticle.color.body: Colors this reticle using provided color.
customServerReticle.drawCenterDot.body: If true, shape is additionally displayed with center dot.
customServerReticle.drawOutline.body: If checked, shape is additionally displayed with 1 pixel black outline.
customServerReticle.drawOutline.note: Useful if shape color blends with the background.
customServerReticle.blend.body: Controls, how much reticle color will blend with the background color instead of replacing it.
Vanilla "dashed" reticle uses this with value 1.0 without outline to make reticle look more natural.
customServerReticle.blend.note:
Set it to 1.0 if you want color to fully act as an addition to background color.
Set it to 0.0 if you want color to fully replace background color.
Values between them controls strength of those effects the closer it gets to them.
customServerReticle.blend.attention: Value 1.0 effectively prevents you from getting dark colors
because ... black color + background color = background color.
reticleSizeMultiplier.body: Scales all reticles size by factor, except SPG top-view reticle.
reticleSizeMultiplier.note:
WG's displayed reticle dispersion is noticeably bigger than actual gun dispersion.
It was discovered by Jak_Attackka, StranikS_Scan and others.
By this setting you can scale it to actual displayed dispersion.

Good known values:
- 1.0 (default "wrong" WG dispersion)
- 0.6 (factor determined by me)
- 0.5848 (factor determined by Jak_Attackka, StranikS_Scan and others)
